image.altText: Photo collage Peter Dutton, Michael Sukkar, David Coleman and Bridget Archer

props.synopsis: No matter how you look at it, the election map paints a very confronting picture for the Coalition and has delivered a serious blow to the Liberals' pipeline of future leaders.

title.children: Election map shows our cities didn't want what the Coalition was selling

image.altText: Palmer scratches his head.

props.synopsis: Despite spending $60 million on campaign advertisements, Clive Palmer's Trumpet of Patriots party has failed to win a single seat in the lower house.

title.children: After millions of dollars and texts, Trumpet of Patriots fails to deliver

image.altText: a male politician wearing glasses looking dismayed

props.synopsis: Liberal internal polling was predicting as late as the final week that it would pick up seats, leaving it sleepwalking into disaster.

title.children: Most polls underestimated Labor. How did they get it wrong?

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns as he looks off camera while Xi Jinping stands behind him.

props.synopsis: America has decided to sever its trading relationship with China — a strategy that ultimately will come at enormous cost. And Australia, more than any other nation, will be caught smack in the middle.

title.children: Australia may be forced to choose between Xi Jinping and Donald Trump

image.altText: ANTHONY ALBANESE SELFIE

props.synopsis: Over the past year when I'd talk to him privately, the prime minister was saying that Peter Dutton's vote would be dragged down by Donald Trump, whether or not he became president.

title.children: Anthony Albanese didn't predict the margin but he saw this coming

image.altText: A man wearing an American Badass t-shirt.

props.synopsis: Most Greenlanders oppose the US president's threats to invade, but some believe it could give them leverage in their fight for independence from Denmark.

title.children: Why Donald Trump's 'Greenlandic son' sees opportunity in US talk of invasion

image.altText: Bejnamin Netanyahu wearing a navy jacket, white shirt and a gold and Israeli flag lapel pin while grimacing

props.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says the population in Gaza "will be moved for its own protection".

title.children: Israel may seize all of Gaza in 'intensive' military operation

image.altText: An old lady sits, leaning on a wall as she holds an empty metal pot.

props.synopsis: As people queue for hours for a bowl of soup, Israel maintains its blockade of food and aid — and the groups keeping people fed warn their supplies are running out.

title.children: Soup kitchens are a lifeline in Gaza, but they're running out of food

image.altText: An elderly woman holding the hand of her adult son on a sidewalk

props.synopsis: Estate planning before your own death can be confronting for anyone. But for parents who have children with disabilities, there are additional complexities to consider.

title.children: A few years ago, Dan was caring for his mum. Now it's the other way around

image.altText: Electricians place solar panels on roof

props.synopsis: Australians overwhelmingly chose household batteries over nuclear, rejecting the Coalition's anti-renewables agenda.

title.children: Sea of solar gives a clue why Australians chose batteries over nuclear

image.altText: Coonabarabran

props.synopsis: A 66-year-old woman has been arrested and remains in hospital under guard after the bodies of two children aged six and and seven were found at a home in Coonabarabran.

title.children: 'Heartbreak' as two boys found dead in NSW, woman in custody

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson "seemed to really like mushrooms", her friends say, and shared pictures of a food dehydrator in the lead-up to a deadly lunch hosted at her home.

title.children: Erin Patterson told friends she'd been 'hiding powdered mushrooms in everything', court hears

image.altText: China Boat Accident 3

props.synopsis: More than 80 people have plunged into a river following strong winds that capsized four tourist boats in China.

title.children: Ten people killed after tourist boats capsize in China

image.altText: A close up of a man looking intently and about to open his mouth to speak. He is wearing a black shirt in a dark room.

props.synopsis: The man accused of orchestrating a series of antisemitic attacks in Sydney has spoken exclusively to Four Corners from his overseas hideout.

title.children: He thought a caravan full of explosives was his ticket home. It became a 'criminal con job'

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair in a composite with a woman with brunette hair.

props.synopsis: With four of Tasmania's six Senate spots certain, four candidates including Jacqui Lambie and Pauline Hanson's daughter are vying for the last two.

title.children: Pauline Hanson's daughter fights with Jacqui Lambie for Senate spot

image.altText: a composite image of three women

props.synopsis: Australia will be represented by more women in federal parliament than ever before, after Saturday's election saw voters choose a series of women over men.

title.children: Record-breaking number of women to enter Parliament

image.altText: A man in a shirt and hat.

props.synopsis: Two Nationals MPs say the Coalition's plan to build seven nuclear power stations must be kept, as the opposition moves to review everything it took to an election that handed them a disastrous result.

title.children: Nationals MPs '100 per cent' back nuclear being kept as Coalition dissects loss

image.altText: a middle-aged man wearing glasses pointing

props.synopsis: The prime minister says he received a "very warm" congratulatory phone call from US President Donald Trump, but says his first overseas visit in the wake of his historic election win will be to Jakarta rather than Washington, DC.

title.children: Albanese says he received 'very warm' phone call from Donald Trump

image.altText: Hastie gestures with one hand while speaking at a press conference in a parliament house courtyard.

props.synopsis: Andrew Hastie's decision leaves Shadow Treasurer Angus Taylor, deputy opposition leader Sussan Ley and Shadow Immigration Minister Dan Tehan in contention. Take a look back at how the day's events unfolded on our live blog.

title.children: Andrew Hastie rules himself out of Liberal Party leadership race — as it happened

image.altText: A young couple

props.synopsis: From the outer suburbs to the seaside, the Coalition was abandoned by its core base. The ABC spoke to voters in key changing seats to ask why.

title.children: 'Laughable policies': Voters explain what went wrong for Coalition

image.altText: Zoe Daniel Doorstop November 2022

props.synopsis: Across the country, key electorates are still awaiting the outcome of the election. Here are the 16 seats to watch.

title.children: Teal MP Zoe Daniel's high-profile seat is just one of 16 still in doubt

image.altText: Donald Trump smiling while speaking at a black microphone and wearing a dark suit and blue tie

props.synopsis: In a post to Truth Social, Donald Trump has announced his plan to rejuvenate the American film industry, with a 100 per cent tariff on movies produced overseas.

title.children: Local film industry's future in doubt as Trump announces 'chilling' tariffs

image.altText: AfD campaign rally

props.synopsis: A far-right party in Germany has filed a lawsuit challenging a spy agency's decision to classify it as an extremist organisation.

title.children: AfD sues German spy agency, Kremlin and US weigh in

image.altText: Bridget McKenzie speaks outside, with two people visible behind her, and a row of trees.

props.synopsis: Nationals senator Bridget McKenzie wants a Labor MP whose seat remains in the balance to retract claims she booed voters at early polling stations in the seat of Bendigo.

title.children: Senator seeks retraction of claim she booed voters taking Labor flyers

image.altText: A composite image showing the exterior of St Vincent's Hospital and a man in a suit, tie and glasses.

props.synopsis: A major Sydney hospital is urgently reviewing more than 1,500 patient records after discovering a litany of errors and incorrect advice by one of its leading cancer specialists, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Hundreds of patient records to be reviewed for errors by specialist

image.altText: People's Action Party supporters hold signs in support of Singapore's Prime Minister Lawrence Wong

props.synopsis: Ahead of the 2025 general election, there was significant redrawing of electoral boundaries, leading to accusations of gerrymandering from government critics.

title.children: Trump 'fear' gives Singapore's ruling party 14th straight election win

image.altText: A poor quality photo of a man with a knife on an escalator, taken from above.

props.synopsis: Body-worn camera footage is shown in the second week of the Bondi Junction stabbing inquest of Queensland Police officers responding to an incident with Joel Cauchi in 2023.

title.children: Police called to dispute over Bondi Junction stabber's knives before attack

image.altText: kayak at Samsonvale 2020

props.synopsis: A 55-year-old man has been charged with murder and fraud over his wife's death, initially considered an accidental drowning.

title.children: Husband charged with murder four years after wife's drowning death

image.altText: A photo of David Rayan leaving court

props.synopsis: David Rayan, 34, has received a two-year community corrections order for multiple offences at the Revolver nightclub in Melbourne in 2023.

title.children: Revolver nightclub groper avoids jail after assaulting 17 women

image.altText: A group of people attempt to push a shark back out to sea

props.synopsis: Authorities have removed a dead shark that washed up on an Adelaide beach on Monday, with testing now underway to determine the cause of death.

title.children: Shark washes up on popular SA beach amid marine life concerns

image.altText: Oscar Piastri attempts the Griddy in front of his team members and crowd after a race

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri enjoys a dominant run to victory at the Miami GP but can't claim an entirely flawless afternoon as his post-race celebration catches the eye.

title.children: Piastri a winner again, but 'poorly executed' Griddy proves he is human

image.altText: A sign at the front of the Broome Shell petrol station, with a bush covering the sign.

props.synopsis: Troy Dean Allan Carter claimed to be under "spiritual attack" when he stole a car from a Broome service station with a woman and six-year-old child inside.

title.children: Man jailed for 'bizarre' theft of car with woman and child inside

image.altText: Albanese, at a press conference, raises his hands while speaking.

props.synopsis: A reshuffle could see at least two elevations to cabinet from the new and enlarged Labor Caucus.

title.children: Albanese to 'slow the pace' as factions jostle over cabinet reshuffle

image.altText: James Alexander Corr (left) and Analisa Josefa Corr arrive at the Downing Centre Local Court i

props.synopsis: Analisa Josefa Corr and her partner James Corr were accused of being "intoxicated" on a flight from Hobart to Sydney last December.

title.children: Philippine president's reported half-sister accused flight staff of 'doing drugs'

props.synopsis: It was a Labor win and a Coalition defeat of a magnitude few expected. Anthony Albanese has become the first prime minister to win re-election in more than 20 years, leaving the Liberal party gutted and its leader kicked out of parliament.

title.children: Laura Tingle on the survival of the Liberal Party
